alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:02PM EDT until September 07 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR CHESTERFIELD COUNTY... At 702 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Moseley to 6 miles north of Sutherland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Chesterfield Court House around 705 PM EDT. Chester around 710 PM EDT. Bon Air around 715 PM EDT. Tuckahoe and Bellwood around 720 PM EDT. Bensley around 725 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Pocahontas State Park, Beach, Winterpock, Midlothian, Drewrys Bluff, Centralia, and Chesterfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
